ygData.msgSnippet: Heck NO!! The Shadow Knight and Paladin have no business woth dual wield. This skill represents a mastery at arms that only the Warrior and the Ranger should
ygData.messageBody:
Heck NO!!
The Shadow Knight and Paladin have no business woth dual wield.
This skill represents a mastery at arms that only the Warrior and the
Ranger should posses. The bottom line is game ballance. Why play any
other class if you can get an instant dammage touch or full heal with
a repertoire of spells and a 9+ level pet to boot?? Verrant has done
well with game ballance. What the charecters need now is some
flavoring...
Consider this. Paladinhood, Shadow standing, and even Ranger
reputation should be a measure of player standing with their
representative organizations. If the standing gets too low, the grace
of the specilty class is lost until attonement is completed, (ie a
minor or major quest alone without the class powers to "fix things"
with their own group.)
Why? These classes are polarized in their alignment. I have met
too many Paladins, as a Shadow Knight, who were bigger jerks than I
was attempting to be! This is rediculous. The dang Paladins are
stealing our reputation!
If buffing the Shadow Knight is being considered to offset the Harm
touch vs Lay Hands debate, I would recommend adding another class
ability. Aura of Fear, for those NPCs in combat against the SK who
are not undead and an Aura of Courage for ALL members in the Paladins
party. A Fear spell could possibly spook a Paladin in battle with the
SK following a failed Harm Touch and a successful (as it should be)
Lay Hands. For the ranger, perhaps an aura of Animal Friendship
when partied with the Ranger? Imagine being able to camp and NOT
worry about Griffins pecking your head! An EQlizer if you will. Food
for thought.

Well, Hate you ALL!!

~Xillith, Lady of Pain
DE of Rallos Zek.
